== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Archuleta was born on December 28, 1990, in Miami, to Guadalupe Mayorga, a salsa singer and dancer, and Jeff Archuleta, a jazz musician.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His mother is from Honduras and his father is of Spanish, Danish, Irish, and German descent.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Archuleta has stated that his surname is of Basque origin.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He speaks fluent Spanish.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Archuleta has four siblings.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Archuleta's family moved to the Salt Lake City suburb of Sandy, Utah, when he was six years old.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He attended Murray High School before appearing on American Idol.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Archuleta began singing at the age of six, inspired by a Les Misérables video.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: "That musical is what started all of this", he said.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He started performing publicly at the age of 10 when he participated in the Utah Talent Competition, singing "I Will Always Love You" by Dolly Parton; he won the Child Division.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: When Archuleta, a member of the LDS Church, was 21, he volunteered for two years as a full-time missionary in Rancuagua, Chile.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Archuleta is a graduate of Barbizon Modeling and Acting School in Salt Lake City.

== Philanthropy ==

sentences: Philanthropy ==
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Along with Do Something and the Dunkin' Brands Community Foundation, Archuleta is involved with helping willing teenagers make a difference in others' lives with disaster relief.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: He was also one of several teen celebrities taking part in DoSomething.org's Teens for Jeans charity initiative, which donates denim to homeless teenagers nationwide.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In January 2010, Haiti was hit with a major earthquake.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: On January 22, 2010, Archuleta joined other celebrities for a two-hour fundraising telethon, where he answered phones and even stayed longer afterward to keep answering the phones.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Archuleta partnered with ChildFund International for his My Kind of Christmas Tour in an effort to increase awareness and recruit new sponsors for children in need worldwide.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Archuleta also surprised some of ChildFund's children in their Philippines program, when he sang Bridge Over Troubled Water, and then met with the children in small groups.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: He has also been one of the most consistent artist supporters of Invisible Children, rallying fans to donate to protection initiatives in Central Africa, and performing at events held by the organization.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In January 2011, Archuleta travelled to Chennai, India, with Rising Star Outreach, a non-profit charity giving children from leper colonies a first-class education and a chance at a future in India.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Archuleta was one of the many Latino singers who participated in Somos El Mundo, the Spanish version of "We Are the World 25 for Haiti".
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: The song and video premiered on the Cristina Show in March 2010; funds raised benefited Haiti relief.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: During the COVID-19 pandemic, Archuleta participated in Billboard's Live At-Home sessions, where he performed piano versions of "OK, All Right", "Crush", and "What a Wonderful World", and released a music video for "Just Breathe" dedicated to the frontline workers; both were fundraisers for Direct Relief.
section: == Philanthropy ==
== Artistry ==

sentences: Artistry ==
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Archuleta's mother is from Honduras, and much of the music he listened to as a child was Latin-influenced, including watching his mom sing at events with her sisters.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: She also "was big on dancing" according to Archuleta, and would "make" him dance to traditional music with his older sister.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He also listened to jazz music, he said, from his father's collection, as well as gospel, pop, rock and "soulful music".
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In a later interview, he revealed that his father was a jazz musician.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Archuleta also said he enjoys Broadway musicals.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: On his American Idol "Fast Facts" page, Archuleta cited his musical influences as Natalie Cole, Stevie Wonder, Kirk Franklin and Bryan Adams.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Like Elliott Yamin and another singer he admires, John Mayer, Archuleta tries to infuse his pop selections with a soulful vibe.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In a Seventeen interview, he cited Sara Bareilles as a clever singer-songwriter whom he looks up to.
section: == Artistry ==
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Since 2015, Archuleta has been residing in Nashville, Tennessee.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He came out as gay to his family in 2014, then publicly announced in June 2021 that he is part of the LGBT community, but "not sure of my own sexuality".
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Archuleta discussed balancing his sexuality with his Mormon faith, stating "I don't feel comfortable sharing it, but felt I needed to bring more awareness to people in my same situation and let you know you're not alone.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: You can be part of the LGBTQIA+ community and still believe in God and His gospel plan."
section: == Personal life ==
